Name: Double pronged spear-butt
Description: Double-pronged metal spear-butt with open-work spiral tendril decoration at the strengthening bar between the prongs, and hollow tubular upper end for the insertion of a wooden shaft. The function of the object is deduced from examples found with spear blades. These have been found in Delta sites, where the wood has perished in the damp soil; this example is from Abydos in Upper Egypt, where organic preservation is variable.
